job_details.Functieomschrijving:
At HubSpot, we have been on an incredible journey building world-class CRM, Marketing, Sales, and Services products that help millions of businesses grow better.

   More and more of HubSpot's customers start their journey as free users, rather than starting by speaking to a sales rep. We are excited to accelerate this freemium business with our Growth Product Group.

   The Growth Product Group is an influential team with a big mission. We want to help millions of organisations around the world grow by empowering people to discover, adopt, and buy HubSpot's products the way they want to. To achieve this, we focus on acquisition, onboarding, retention, and monetisation across the entire HubSpot product platform.

   Within Growth, the Acquisition Group aims to motivate and reassure potential customers that HubSpot is the right choice for them. A frictionless and conversational journey from discovery to team usage, which demonstrates the value and matches their business objective, where they feel validated in their choice.

   Staff Software Engineers are highly productive, impactful, and trusted engineers who leverage their skills and knowledge to work autonomously on the most complex projects and set technical direction. Very complex problems can include those that are very broad, very deep, or problems that require spanning across many teams.

   As a Staff Software Engineer on Growth Acquisition, you will:
     * Help high-value users to find and start their journey with HubSpot
     * Support Acquisition, Distribution and Affiliations initiatives, building APIs and tools that will help Signup, Integrations and Partnerships
     * Write and ship production code that has meaningful user and business impact
     * Envision, build and analyze new features and tools, each contributing to company growth and revenue
     * Work with a small cross-functional team of engineers, PMs, designers, content designers, and researchers
     * Collaborate with HubSpotters all over the company, whether in engineering, product, design, research, marketing, sales, etc
     * Help HubSpot users meet their goals, via changes you've made
     * Implement experiments that give us valuable insights into user behavior and how to improve their experience
     * Get exposure to how HubSpot works as a business

   We're not just looking for engineers with many years of experience. Instead we're looking for engineers who also have a track record of unique excellence, leadership, and levelling up those around them.

   We are looking for someone to be hands-on. We are not necessarily looking for the typical Architect role, which tends to be less hands-on. That being said, we would be also interested in someone coming from an architectural background as long as they are looking to be more hands-on.

   We are looking for someone with demonstrated leadership capability. Good candidates will often have had some time as managers, but their passion is more in technology.

   You may be a fit if:
     * You enjoy problem solving and working full stack, across a broad set of technologies. We work primarily with TypeScript, React, and Java, but experience with specific technologies is secondary to strong programming fundamentals
     * You are willing to be challenged by solving complex cross-team problem & opportunities, helping set the direction of the group
     * You have an interest in generative AI and how it can be applied to improving user experience
     * You have or are interested in developing data analysis skills. You're not afraid to dive into Amplitude, Looker, Excel, or other data analysis tools and collaborate with our ops and analytics teams
     * You are interested in becoming a master of the experimentation process and A/B tests
     * You have a strong focus on the user. You can gain empathy for their challenges and understand how they may flow through our product.
     * You not only get excited about big, technical challenges but also about being very close to the business and our go-to-market strategies
     __________________________________________________

   We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply - we'd love to hear from you.

   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at interviewaccommodation@hubspot.com.This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.
     __________________________________________________

   Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.
     __________________________________________________

   About HubSpot

   HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers' needs at any stage of growth. We're also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.

   You can find out more about our company culture in theHubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn aboutour commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

   Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit ourcareers websiteto learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.
     __________________________________________________

   By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.

   Over het bedrijf:
   HubSpot
job_details.full_text:
Staff Software Engineer, Growth Acquisition

At HubSpot, we have been on an incredible journey building world-class CRM, Marketing, Sales, and Services products that help millions of businesses grow better.

   More and more of HubSpot's customers start their journey as free users, rather than starting by speaking to a sales rep. We are excited to accelerate this freemium business with our Growth Product Group.

   The Growth Product Group is an influential team with a big mission. We want to help millions of organisations around the world grow by empowering people to discover, adopt, and buy HubSpot's products the way they want to. To achieve this, we focus on acquisition, onboarding, retention, and monetisation across the entire HubSpot product platform.

   Within Growth, the Acquisition Group aims to motivate and reassure potential customers that HubSpot is the right choice for them. A frictionless and conversational journey from discovery to team usage, which demonstrates the value and matches their business objective, where they feel validated in their choice.

   Staff Software Engineers are highly productive, impactful, and trusted engineers who leverage their skills and knowledge to work autonomously on the most complex projects and set technical direction. Very complex problems can include those that are very broad, very deep, or problems that require spanning across many teams.

   As a Staff Software Engineer on Growth Acquisition, you will:
     * Help high-value users to find and start their journey with HubSpot
     * Support Acquisition, Distribution and Affiliations initiatives, building APIs and tools that will help Signup, Integrations and Partnerships
     * Write and ship production code that has meaningful user and business impact
     * Envision, build and analyze new features and tools, each contributing to company growth and revenue
     * Work with a small cross-functional team of engineers, PMs, designers, content designers, and researchers
     * Collaborate with HubSpotters all over the company, whether in engineering, product, design, research, marketing, sales, etc
     * Help HubSpot users meet their goals, via changes you've made
     * Implement experiments that give us valuable insights into user behavior and how to improve their experience
     * Get exposure to how HubSpot works as a business

   We're not just looking for engineers with many years of experience. Instead we're looking for engineers who also have a track record of unique excellence, leadership, and levelling up those around them.

   We are looking for someone to be hands-on. We are not necessarily looking for the typical Architect role, which tends to be less hands-on. That being said, we would be also interested in someone coming from an architectural background as long as they are looking to be more hands-on.

   We are looking for someone with demonstrated leadership capability. Good candidates will often have had some time as managers, but their passion is more in technology.

     * You are willing to be challenged by solving complex cross-team problem & opportunities, helping set the direction of the group

     * You have or are interested in developing data analysis skills. You're not afraid to dive into Amplitude, Looker, Excel, or other data analysis tools and collaborate with our ops and analytics teams
     * You are interested in becoming a master of the experimentation process and A/B tests
     * You have a strong focus on the user. You can gain empathy for their challenges and understand how they may flow through our product.
     * You not only get excited about big, technical challenges but also about being very close to the business and our go-to-market strategies
     __________________________________________________

   We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply - we'd love to hear from you.

   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at interviewaccommodation@hubspot.com.This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software engineering, growth acquisition, and business impact. While it mentions an interest in generative AI and data analysis skills, these are not the primary focus or core responsibilities. The role is described as a Staff Software Engineer with a hands-on, full-stack approach, rather than a specialized AI/ML role. The core tasks involve building APIs, tools for signup/integrations/partnerships, writing production code, and implementing experiments, which align more with general software engineering and product development than specialized ML or GenAI engineering.

job_tasks.justification: The role is within the 'Growth Product Group' and focuses on 'acquisition, onboarding, retention, and monetisation across the entire HubSpot product platform.' The engineer will 'help high-value users to find and start their journey with HubSpot,' 'support Acquisition, Distribution and Affiliations initiatives,' and 'envision, build and analyze new features and tools, each contributing to company growth and revenue.' The description also states the candidate will 'get exposure to how HubSpot works as a business' and have 'a strong focus on the business and our go-to-market strategies.'
job_tasks.phrase: contributing to company growth and revenue

job_tasks.justification: The engineer will 'help millions of organisations around the world grow by empowering people to discover, adopt, and buy HubSpot's products the way they want to.' This highlights a deep understanding of business goals and customer needs.
job_tasks.phrase: help millions of organisations around the world grow

job_tasks.justification: The role aims to 'motivate and reassure potential customers that HubSpot is the right choice for them,' indicating a focus on understanding customer decision-making processes and business objectives.
job_tasks.phrase: motivate and reassure potential customers that HubSpot is the right choice for them

job_tasks.justification: The role involves implementing experiments and analyzing user behavior to improve their experience, which requires data analysis skills. It also mentions collaborating with ops and analytics teams and diving into data analysis tools.
job_tasks.phrase: Implement experiments that give us valuable insights into user behavior

job_tasks.justification: The description explicitly mentions developing data analysis skills and using tools like Amplitude, Looker, and Excel.
job_tasks.phrase: develop data analysis skills. You're not afraid to dive into Amplitude, Looker, Excel, or other data analysis tools

job_tasks.justification: While not the primary focus, the job description expresses an interest in generative AI and how it can be applied to improving user experience, suggesting potential involvement in modeling or leveraging existing models.
job_tasks.phrase: an interest in generative AI and how it can be applied to improving user experience

job_tasks.justification: The role involves being 'highly productive, impactful, and trusted engineers who leverage their skills and knowledge to work autonomously on the most complex projects and set technical direction.' It also mentions writing and shipping production code and working full stack.

The engineer will 'Support Acquisition, Distribution and Affiliations initiatives, building APIs and tools that will help Signup, Integrations and Partnerships.' This is a direct indication of software development for application integration and functionality.
job_tasks.phrase: building APIs and tools that will help Signup, Integrations and Partnerships

job_tasks.justification: The role requires working 'full stack, across a broad set of technologies,' indicating comprehensive software development responsibilities.
job_tasks.phrase: working full stack, across a broad set of technologies

job_tasks.justification: The role emphasizes implementing experiments and A/B tests, which involves setting up and managing these processes to gather insights, aligning with operational aspects of product development and testing.
job_tasks.phrase: master of the experimentation process and A/B tests

soft_skills.phrase: Work with a small cross-functional team of engineers, PMs, designers, content designers, and researchers
Collaborate with HubSpotters all over the company, whether in engineering, product, design, research, marketing, sales, etc
You are willing to be challenged by solving complex cross-team problem & opportunities
Very complex problems can include those that are very broad, very deep, or problems that require spanning across many teams.
Staff Software Engineers are highly productive, impactful, and trusted engineers who leverage their skills and knowledge to work autonomously on the most complex projects and set technical direction.
We are looking for engineers who also have a track record of unique excellence, leadership, and levelling up those around them.
We are looking for someone with demonstrated leadership capability.
